title: Static checking
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I'm new here. I tried this code:

```rust
#![allow(dead_code)]
use std::marker::PhantomData;

struct Slice<'a, T: 'a> {
    start: *const T,
    end: *const T,
    phantom: PhantomData<&'a T>,
}

fn borrow_vec<T>(vec: &Vec<T>) -> Slice<'_, T> {
    let ptr = vec.as_ptr();
    Slice {
        start: ptr,
        end: unsafe { ptr.add(vec.len()) },
        phantom: PhantomData,
    }
}

fn f1() {
    let sl;
    {
        let vec = vec![1];
        sl = borrow_vec(&vec);
    }
    let __ = sl;
}

fn f2() {
    let sl;
    {
        let vec = vec![1];
        let ptr = vec.as_ptr();
        sl = Slice {
            start: ptr,
            end: unsafe { ptr.add(vec.len()) },
            phantom: PhantomData,
        };
    }
    let __ = sl;
}

fn main() {}
```

I expected to see this happen: *`fn f2()` compile failure*

Instead, this happened: *`fn f2()` compile success*
